title: Lynda - Foundations of Networking: Network Media (WANs)

Lynda - Foundations of Networking: Network Media (WANs)
Subject: IT

Author:  Greg Sowell 

FYI : This Course will be good to the Best for DL within 30 days after has been posed, after that it might not be good DL already, please do me favour to continue seeding to keep this torrent alive.

2h 2m Beginner Feb 29, 2016 | Uploaded in Mar 26, 2016 by 2boweb

With some simple hardware and routing protocols, you can connect offices in almost any location. Wide area networks (WANs) allow data to be shared securely and quickly over long distances. In this course, networking expert Greg Sowell describes how to set up WANs, including networking your workstations with switchs and connecting them to the Internet via a routing device.â€¨â€¨He discusses different WAN technologies and features such as speeds, spans, and price pointsâ€”including inexpensive options such as VPN. He then covers switches (the devices that connect computers in your building) and routers (devices that control the transmission of network data). Along the way, Greg shows how to build private connections, implement free networking over the Internet, build switch networks, and overlay-routed networks. He'll also introduce different routing protocols, such as OPSF link-state routing and distance-vector routing with RIPv2, EIGRP, and BGP.â€¨â€¨Note that this course maps to domains 1 and 2 of the Microsoft Technology Associate (MTA) Networking Fundamentals certification exam (98-366). 
Topics include:
	â€¢	Understanding the technology: from dial-up to VPNs
	â€¢	Working with hubs, bridges, and switches
	â€¢	Ensuring hardware redundancy
	â€¢	Using switching types and MAC tables
	â€¢	Preventing bridge loops with STP
	â€¢	Routing with routing tables
	â€¢	Using NAT
	â€¢	Securing your switches and routers
	â€¢	Setting up firewalls
	â€¢	Working with different routing protocols: RIPv2, OSPF, EIGRP, and more
